qas.question: How does Switzerland rank worldwide in areas such as quality of life and civil liberties?

answers.text: top or close to the top

qas.question: Which country has the highest nominal wealth per adult in the world according to Credit Suisse?
Which two Swiss cities have been ranked as having the highest quality of life in the world?
What assets are included in nominal wealth?
What is Switzerland's ranking for per capita gross domestic product on the IMF list?

context: <a1_0>Switzerland<a1_0/> is one of the richest and wealthiest countries in the world. Switzerland ranks <a0_0>top or close to the top<a0_0/> in several metrics of national performance, including government transparency, civil liberties, quality of life, economic competitiveness, and human development. It has the highest nominal wealth (<a3_0>financial and non-financial<a3_0/> assets) per adult in the world according to Credit Suisse and the <a4_0>eighth-highest<a4_0/> per capita gross domestic product on the IMF list. <a2_0>Zürich and Geneva<a2_0/> have each been ranked among the top cities with the highest quality of life in the world, with the former ranked 2nd globally, according to Mercer.
